job_description: Embedded Software Engineer - job post Troxel Aerospace Industries, Inc. San Diego, CA $85,000 - $185,000 a year -  Full-time, Part-time, Contract Responded to 51-74% of applications in the past 30 days, typically within 10 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $85,000 - $185,000 a year Job Type Full-time Part-time Contract Company Overview Founded in 2015, Troxel Aerospace Industries, Inc., (Troxel Aerospace) is the world leader in radiation testing and development of fault-tolerant software solutions for satellites. We are an employee-owned company comprised of a small team of engineers who design and environmentally test aerospace and high reliability systems by leveraging decades of experience to deliver successful solutions to civil, defense, and commercial programs. Description Associates in this position lead and contribute code to teams that develop embedded software to support our products and radiation testing of aerospace processor systems. Positions Currently hiring up to two associates at either the junior or senior level, possibilities for full-time salary or part-time contract work. Essential Functions · Develop new software and expand existing software per project requirements in a process-oriented software development environment for embedded, resource-constrained systems · Work with software requirements and architecture, prototyping, design, implementation, integration, test, documentation and delivery of software · Demonstrate familiarity with various processor, memory, I/O architectures, multi-core systems, and heterogeneous systems · Demonstrate a fluent understanding of compiled languages, scripting languages, assembly, and machine code · Work with conventional operating systems (e.g., Linux), real-time operating systems (e.g., VxWorks), and hypervisors for multi-core processors, and their associated host/development environments and tools · Follow industry and company best practices for developing software that emphasizes correctness, modularity, portability, comprehensibility, and proper error handling · Develop test code to validate modules and their integration to the larger system through regression testing · Demonstrate excellent communication ability, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interface with all levels of associates, customers, and suppliers including supporting bid and proposal efforts · Thrive in lab and radiation test facility environments and be able to collaborate closely with system engineers, hardware designers, and integration/test engineers · Lead development teams while also providing substantial contributions to all stages of the development process · Thrive in a self-managed work environment with high expectations, significantly diverse assignments, collaborative/team settings across all levels Minimum Qualifications · Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering and at least 5 years of software engineering industry experience post-graduation · Experience with embedded software development using C, C++, and Python and version control software on multicore processors · Experience using POSIX shell and utilities, multi-threading and inter-process communication synchronization, Linux kernel internals and use such as partitioning and mounting devices, networking stack, init systems, process management, serial consoles, and SSH, FTP, TFTP, and DHCP · Ability to obtain and maintain an active in-scope TS/SCI clearance Preferred Qualifications · Master’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering and at least 10 years of directly applicable software engineering industry experience post-graduation · The minimum qualifications and knowledgeable in fault tolerant system design, high assurance software, flight critical software, embedded systems, hardware/software interfacing and drivers, concurrency and parallel programming, distributed systems, GPU programming with OpenCL and Cuda on AMD and NVIDIA GPUs, compiler internals, and hypervisors · Currently holds an active in-scope TS/SCI clearance Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract Pay: $85,000.00 - $185,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Application Question(s): Are you a U.S. Citizen? Experience: Embedded software: 2 years (Required) Distributed systems: 1 year (Required) Work Location: In person Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
